intro: Rhodax distachyos, commonly known as the narrowleaf rhodax, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or arid environments. Rhodax distachyos is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
